content.title: Long Term Fellowship under the Human Resource Development Programme for Health Research
content.details: Long Term Fellowship under the Human Resource Development Programme for Health Research aims to provide advanced training in India and abroad to medical and health research personnel in cutting-edge research areas related to medicine and health to create trained human resources for carrying out advanced research activities. The scheme is intended to create a pool of talented health research personnel in the country by upgrading the skills of medical students & faculty through specialized training in priority areas of health research in leading national and international institutions.
benefits: A consolidated stipend of ₹40,000/- per month for a period of stay in the host institute in India.
Expenditure on travel as per the T.A. rules of the parent organization.
One-time contingency grant of ₹30,000 (maximum) for local expenses.
A consolidated stipend of US $3000/- per month for a period of stay in the host institute abroad.
Cost of air passage in economy class by Air India.
One-time contingency grant of ₹50,000 (maximum) for local expenses in foreign institutes.
eligibility: Only Indian citizens working in Indian institutes are eligible.
Having M.D./ M.S./ M.D.S. or MBBS/BDS/ MVSc./ M.Sc./ M.Pharma/ M.Tech or equivalent with Ph.D. in a topic related to health/ medical research.
The faculty should have at least three years of experience in the institute as a regular employee.
Candidate should be below 45 years of age as of the last date of receipt of application.
They should not have availed any fellowship of one month or above from any of the agencies of the Government of India/State Government for the same subject of training/research project.
content.application_process: The full-length research proposals may be submitted online only through the DHR Electronics Project Management System (e-PMS) portal.
documents_required: Mandate Form from your working Institute
Format of Utilization certificate and Statement of expenditure

faqs.question: What is the aim of this programme?
faqs.answer: The aim of the programme is to provide advanced training in India and abroad to medical and health research personnel in cutting-edge research areas related to medicine and health.

faqs.question: What is the objective of the programme?
faqs.answer: The objective of the scheme is to increase the overall availability of trained personnel for health research from medical colleges across the country.

faqs.question: Which is the implementing agency of this programme?
faqs.answer: Department of Health Research, Ministry of Health & Family Welfare, Government of India.

faqs.question: Who are eligible to apply?
faqs.answer: The Indian citizens having M.D./ M.S./ M.D.S. or MBBS/BDS/ MVSc./ M.Sc./ M.Pharma/ M.Tech or equivalent with Ph.D. in a topic related to health/ medical research.

faqs.question: What is the duration of fellowship?
faqs.answer: The duration of fellowship is 6-12 months.
